div.p: Updates and Reminders for Students and Families.

Governor Hutchinson announced on Monday, April 6, that schools are closed for on-site instruction for the remainder of the school year. SSSD will continue with our digital learning plan until the end of the school year.

li.p: Students need to be checking their school email daily for updates and assignments from teachers, counselors and administrators. If your child has not submitted work, has difficulty with the work or with completing work, please contact the teacher or the school office.

Any questions that students or parents have regarding classes need to be directed to the teacher of the class via email. Teachers have posted office hours each day when they are readily available to answer questions.
Instruction will be focused on essential standards for each grade-level and/or subject area.
Effective Monday, April 13, meals will be delivered on Mondays and Wednesdays only. We will continue to make deliveries at current bus stops and on-site at all school campuses except Northside.

Free WiFi is available at various locations throughout the district. You may park at any of these locations to access the internet. Locations are posted on the district website and social media accounts.
Please check the website and social media for regular updates.

div.p: If parents or students have any questions, contact the school office Monday thru Friday from 8am to 3:00 pm. Assistance for Spanish speakers is available by calling the school office or Jimena Fernandez at 479-524-6184 ext 10062.

p.span: Please continue to check the website and social media for updates.

div.div:
Siloam Springs is located in one of the fastest growing regions in the United States. It is in Northwest Arkansas, covers approximately 12 square miles, and is home to approximately 15,000 people.
Recent Recognition:
· Named one of the Top Twenty Best Small Towns in America by Smithsonian Magazine in 2012
· Featured in Parade Magazine as having one of the top 4 Main Streets in the Country(with over 2,000 nominated) in 2014
· Named one of the 10 Most Beautiful Towns in Arkansas in 2015.
Siloam Springs is home to John Brown University, rated as number one among Regional Colleges in the South by U.S. News and World Report. The Siloam Springs School District and John Brown University have a long-standing partnership and have entered into a collaborative partnership dedicated to the simultaneous redesign of teacher education and renewal of K-12 teacher education through the development of the Professional Development School.
Many major industries located in Siloam Springs include Simmons Foods, Alternative Design, Cobb-Vantress, La-Z-Boy, McKee Foods, Pipe Life-JetStream, DaySpring Cards, and Gates Rubber.
Siloam Springs is also located close to the University of Arkansas in Fayetteville, the Northwest Arkansas Community College in Bentonville, Northwest Technical Institute in Springdale and Northeastern State University in Tahlequah, Oklahoma.
The Northwest Arkansas Regional Airport (XNA) is only thirty minutes from Siloam Springs.
The school district contains six campuses with a total enrollment of approximately 4,100 students.
The Siloam Springs High School Scholarship Program is a nationally recognized program. Last year, over $600,000 in local scholarship money was awarded to 185 high school seniors, with 100% of students who applied for local scholarships receiving financial assistance. Over $11 million dollars has been awarded in local money over the thirty-eight year history of the program.
The district has a very active Adopt-A-School program at all levels with over 77 participants from local businesses and civic organizations. Our facilities are open to the City Parks and Recreation Department and the local Boys and Girls Club.
With tremendous support from the community, the Siloam Springs School District has made its mission "Changing lives through educational excellence." Siloam Springs School District’s vision is: "To ensure student success, the Siloam Springs School District utilizes innovative approaches, partnerships, and resources to meet the individual needs of every student."
This mission and vision is apparent all the way through the District, beginning with a state-recognized, Better Beginnings pre-k, and concluding in a newly-built, award-winning high school. Community members volunteer time, hard work, and financial support to help build a great school system at every grade level.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
